14.plot: Childhood favorites, including cotton candy, Frito pie and homemade pasta, are recalled by Michael Symon, Bobby Flay and Gail Simmons.

1.title: All American

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

1.plot: All-American favorites, including fried chicken, hot dogs and apple pie, are discussed by Guy Fieri, Michael Symon, Alton Brown and Bobby Flay in the Season 6 opener.

2.title: New Orleans

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

2.plot: New Orleans favorites, including beignets, bread pudding and banana-cream pie, are discussed by Alton Brown, Emeril Lagasse, Claire Robinson and Wolfgang Puck.

3.title: Messy

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

3.plot: Memorable messy eats, from a lasagna sandwich to a burger smothered in slaw, are recalled by Andrew Zimmern, Duff Goldman and Alton Brown.

4.title: As Good as Mom's

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

4.plot: Wolfgang Puck, Curtis Stone and Andrew Zimmern discuss dishes that remind them of their mothers' cooking, from chili rellenos to macaroons.

5.title: Frightfully Good

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

5.plot: Freaky eats, from fried brains to spleen sandwiches, are discussed by TV chefs, including Curtis Stone, Michael Symon and Ming Tsai.

6.title: Bird Is the Word

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

6.plot: Memorable bird dishes, including crispy Peking duck; roasted quail; turkey stuffed with a duck and a chicken, are discussed by Guy Fieri, Bobby Flay and Claire Robinson.

7.title: Season's Eatings

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

7.plot: TV chefs discuss their favorite holiday foods, from traditional fruitcake to rose-petal petit fours. Appearing: Bobby Flay, Alex Guarnaschelli, Curtis Stone, Michael Symon.

1.title: Chicago

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

1.plot: Indulging in Chicago foods with Gino's deep dish pizza, the pork rinds at Publican, and the classic Chicago dog at Weiner Circle; enjoying Chicago's white chocolate goodies.

2.title: New England

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

2.plot: From classics like the Boston Cream Pie to sticky buns that'll sway one's loyalty, viewers are taken on a tour of the best that New England has to offer; trying the Szechuan sliced fish in Chinatown; tasting the ultimate roast chicken in Cambridge.

3.title: Mid-Atlantic

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

3.plot: Touring the Mid-Atlantic and sampling crab cakes in Baltimore; trying paella in Washington, D.C.; visiting Chap's Pit Beef; tasting a chocolate, marshmallow, peanut creation called the CMP at Woodbury Kitchen; enjoying Baltimore's own bomb pie.

4.title: Los Angeles

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

4.plot: Experiencing the famous French dip at Phillippe's; the chicken and waffles at a local favorite called Roscoe's; discovering some of the best tacos in a truck; experiencing a crave-worthy chili dog that comes straight from a train.

5.title: Memphis

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

5.plot: From sweet deals on steak dinners at The Butchershop, to the guilty pleasure of indulgent surf and turf at Iris, Memphis will have customers singing with joy; finding delicious barbecue at Rendezvous in the form of a pulled pork sandwich.

7.title: Dallas

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

7.plot: The brisket at North Main BBQ bowls customers over with its world-famous brisket; visiting Babe's to satisfy crunchy cravings with their fried chicken; sampling the Pecan Ball at Café Pacific and the classic fruitcake at Collins Bakery.

8.title: Miami

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

8.plot: Miami cuisine, from stone crabs at Joe's, to the lamb shank at Sardinia; Fratelli La Bufala turns out pillowy calzones; Ola offers a pear granita; a trifecta of treats at Michael's Genuine and the chocolate peanut butter s'more from Prime 112.

9.title: Philadelphia

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

9.plot: Enjoying delicious food in Philadelphia; featuring pasta at Vetri; mashed potatoes at Parc; crepes at Creperie Beau Monde; Mexican tiramisu at Lolita; Philly cheesesteak at Tony Luke's; the Junkyard Special at Sarcone's Deli;

10.title: Seattle

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

10.plot: Crab cakes at Dahlia; pizza at Serious Pie; Raclette at Le Pichet; from the donuts at Lola and the rhubarb sorbet in Kirkland's Café Juanita to Fran's best chocolate bars, Seattle's got the West Coast covered when it comes to sweets.

11.title: NOLA

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

11.plot: Heading to New Orleans for some seriously delicious, world-renowned food; Po'Boys at Johnny's; Drago's amazing oysters; Mullaletta at Domilises; gumbo at Docky Chase's; pastries at Café Beignet;

12.title: New York

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

12.plot: Velselka's borscht in the East Village; smoked herring on the Upper West Side; hand-pulled noodles in Chinatown; Cuban grilled corn at Café Habana in SoHo; Motorino's special round slice of pizza.

7.title: Southern Charm

episode of.title: The Best Thing I Ever Ate (TV Series 2009– )

7.plot: Roger Mooking, Chef Beau MacMillan and Alton Brown point you in the direction of the best rich, hearty, homestyle cooking straight from the South.
